017package org.apache.juneau.serializer;
018
019import static org.apache.juneau.collections.JsonMap.*;
020import static org.apache.juneau.common.utils.Utils.*;
021
022import java.io.*;
023import java.lang.annotation.*;
024import java.util.*;
025import java.util.function.*;
026
027import org.apache.juneau.*;
028import org.apache.juneau.annotation.*;
029import org.apache.juneau.collections.*;
030import org.apache.juneau.internal.*;
031import org.apache.juneau.soap.*;
032import org.apache.juneau.utils.*;
033
034/**
035 * Parent class for all Juneau serializers.
036 *
037 * <h5 class='topic'>Description</h5>
038 * <p>
039 * Base serializer class that serves as the parent class for all serializers.
040 *
041 * <p>
042 * The purpose of this class is:
043 * <ul>
044 *    <li>Maintain a read-only configuration state of a serializer.
045 *    <li>Create session objects used for serializing POJOs (i.e. {@link SerializerSession}).
046 *    <li>Provide convenience methods for serializing POJOs without having to construct session objects.
047 * </ul>
048 *
049 * <p>
050 * Subclasses should (but are not required to) extend directly from {@link OutputStreamSerializer} or {@link WriterSerializer} depending on
051 * whether it's a stream or character based serializer.
052 *
053 * <p>
054 * Subclasses must implement parsing via one of the following methods:
055 * <ul class='javatree'>
056 *    <li class='jmp'>{@link #doSerialize(SerializerSession, SerializerPipe, Object)}
057 *    <li class='jmp'>{@link SerializerSession#doSerialize(SerializerPipe, Object)}
058 * </ul>
059 * <br>
060 *
061 * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
062 *    <li class='note'>This class is thread safe and reusable.
063 * </ul>
064 *
065 * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
066 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/SerializersAndParsers">Serializers and Parsers</a>
067
068 * </ul>
069 */
070public class Serializer extends BeanTraverseContext {
071
072   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
073   // Static
074   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
075
076   /**
077    * Creates a new builder for this object.
078    *
079    * @return A new builder.
080    */
081   public static Builder create() {
082      return new Builder();
083   }
084
085   /**
086    * Represents no Serializer.
087    */
088   public static abstract class Null extends Serializer {
089      private Null(Builder builder) {
090         super(builder);
091      }
092   }
093
094   /**
095    * Instantiates a builder of the specified serializer class.
096    *
097    * <p>
098    * Looks for a public static method called <c>create</c> that returns an object that can be passed into a public
099    * or protected constructor of the class.
100    *
101    * @param c The builder to create.
102    * @return A new builder.
103    */
104   public static Builder createSerializerBuilder(Class<? extends Serializer> c) {
105      return (Builder)Context.createBuilder(c);
106   }
107
108   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
109   // Builder
110   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
111
112   /**
113    * Builder class.
114    */
115   @FluentSetters
116   public static class Builder extends BeanTraverseContext.Builder {
117
118      boolean addBeanTypes, addRootType, keepNullProperties, sortCollections, sortMaps, trimEmptyCollections,
119         trimEmptyMaps, trimStrings;
120      String produces, accept;
121      UriContext uriContext;
122      UriRelativity uriRelativity;
123      UriResolution uriResolution;
124      Class<? extends SerializerListener> listener;
125
126      /**
127       * Constructor, default settings.
128       */
129      protected Builder() {
130         produces = null;
131         accept = null;
132         addBeanTypes = env("Serializer.addBeanTypes", false);
133         addRootType = env("Serializer.addRootType", false);
134         keepNullProperties = env("Serializer.keepNullProperties", false);
135         sortCollections = env("Serializer.sortCollections", false);
136         sortMaps = env("Serializer.sortMaps", false);
137         trimEmptyCollections = env("Serializer.trimEmptyCollections", false);
138         trimEmptyMaps = env("Serializer.trimEmptyMaps", false);
139         trimStrings = env("Serializer.trimStrings", false);
140         uriContext = UriContext.DEFAULT;
141         uriRelativity = UriRelativity.RESOURCE;
142         uriResolution = UriResolution.NONE;
143         listener = null;
144      }
145
146      /**
147       * Copy constructor.
148       *
149       * @param copyFrom The bean to copy from.
150       */
151      protected Builder(Serializer copyFrom) {
152         super(copyFrom);
153         produces = copyFrom.produces;
154         accept = copyFrom.accept;
155         addBeanTypes = copyFrom.addBeanTypes;
156         addRootType = copyFrom.addRootType;
157         keepNullProperties = copyFrom.keepNullProperties;
158         sortCollections = copyFrom.sortCollections;
159         sortMaps = copyFrom.sortMaps;
160         trimEmptyCollections = copyFrom.trimEmptyCollections;
161         trimEmptyMaps = copyFrom.trimEmptyMaps;
162         trimStrings = copyFrom.trimStrings;
163         uriContext = copyFrom.uriContext;
164         uriRelativity = copyFrom.uriRelativity;
165         uriResolution = copyFrom.uriResolution;
166         listener = copyFrom.listener;
167      }
168
169      /**
170       * Copy constructor.
171       *
172       * @param copyFrom The builder to copy from.
173       */
174      protected Builder(Builder copyFrom) {
175         super(copyFrom);
176         produces = copyFrom.produces;
177         accept = copyFrom.accept;
178         addBeanTypes = copyFrom.addBeanTypes;
179         addRootType = copyFrom.addRootType;
180         keepNullProperties = copyFrom.keepNullProperties;
181         sortCollections = copyFrom.sortCollections;
182         sortMaps = copyFrom.sortMaps;
183         trimEmptyCollections = copyFrom.trimEmptyCollections;
184         trimEmptyMaps = copyFrom.trimEmptyMaps;
185         trimStrings = copyFrom.trimStrings;
186         uriContext = copyFrom.uriContext;
187         uriRelativity = copyFrom.uriRelativity;
188         uriResolution = copyFrom.uriResolution;
189         listener = copyFrom.listener;
190      }
191
192      @Override /* Context.Builder */
193      public Builder copy() {
194         return new Builder(this);
195      }
196
197      @Override /* Context.Builder */
198      public Serializer build() {
199         return build(Serializer.class);
200      }
201
202      @Override /* Context.Builder */
203      public HashKey hashKey() {
204         return HashKey.of(
205            super.hashKey(),
206            produces,
207            accept,
208            addBeanTypes,
209            addRootType,
210            keepNullProperties,
211            sortCollections,
212            sortMaps,
213            trimEmptyCollections,
214            trimEmptyMaps,
215            trimStrings,
216            uriContext,
217            uriRelativity,
218            uriResolution,
219            listener
220         );
221      }
222
223      //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
224      // Properties
225      //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
226
227      /**
228       * Specifies the media type that this serializer produces.
229       *
230       * @param value The value for this setting.
231       * @return This object.
232       */
233      @FluentSetter
234      public Builder produces(String value) {
235         this.produces = value;
236         return this;
237      }
238
239      /**
240       * Returns the current value for the 'produces' property.
241       *
242       * @return The current value for the 'produces' property.
243       */
244      public String getProduces() {
245         return produces;
246      }
247
248      /**
249       *    Specifies the accept media types that the serializer can handle.
250       *
251       *    <p>
252       *    Can contain meta-characters per the <c>media-type</c> specification of <a class="doclink" href="https://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec14.html">RFC2616/14.1</a>
253       *    <p>
254       *    If empty, then assumes the only media type supported is <c>produces</c>.
255       *    <p>
256       *    For example, if this serializer produces <js>"application/json"</js> but should handle media types of
257       *    <js>"application/json"</js> and <js>"text/json"</js>, then the arguments should be:
258       *    <p class='bjava'>
259       *       <jv>builder</jv>.produces(<js>"application/json"</js>);
260       *       <jv>builder</jv>.accept(<js>"application/json,text/json"</js>);
261       *    </p>
262       * <p>
263       * The accept value can also contain q-values.
264       *
265       * @param value The value for this setting.
266       * @return This object.
267       */
268      @FluentSetter
269      public Builder accept(String value) {
270         this.accept = value;
271         return this;
272      }
273
274      /**
275       * Returns the current value for the 'accept' property.
276       *
277       * @return The current value for the 'accept' property.
278       */
279      public String getAccept() {
280         return accept;
281      }
282
283      /**
284       * Add <js>"_type"</js> properties when needed.
285       *
286       * <p>
287       * When enabled, <js>"_type"</js> properties will be added to beans if their type cannot be inferred
288       * through reflection.
289       *
290       * <p>
291       * This is used to recreate the correct objects during parsing if the object types cannot be inferred.
292       * <br>For example, when serializing a <c>Map&lt;String,Object&gt;</c> field where the bean class cannot be determined from
293       * the type of the values.
294       *
295       * <p>
296       * Note the differences between the following settings:
297       * <ul class='javatree'>
298       *    <li class='jf'>{@link #addRootType()} - Affects whether <js>'_type'</js> is added to root node.
299       *    <li class='jf'>{@link #addBeanTypes()} - Affects whether <js>'_type'</js> is added to any nodes.
300       * </ul>
301       *
302       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
303       * <p class='bjava'>
304       *    <jc>// Create a serializer that adds _type to nodes.</jc>
305       *    WriterSerializer <jv>serializer</jv> = JsonSerializer
306       *       .<jsm>create</jsm>()
307       *       .addBeanTypes()
308       *       .build();
309       *
310       *    <jc>// Our map of beans to serialize.</jc>
311       *    <ja>@Bean</ja>(typeName=<js>"mybean"</js>)
312       *    <jk>public class</jk> MyBean {
313       *       <jk>public</jk> String <jf>foo</jf> = <js>"bar"</js>;
314       *    }
315       *    JsonMap <jv>myMap</jv> = JsonMap.of(<js>"foo"</js>, <jk>new</jk> MyBean());
316       *
317       *    <jc>// Will contain:  {"foo":{"_type":"mybean","foo":"bar"}}</jc>
318       *    String <jv>json</jv> = <jv>serializer</jv>.serialize(<jv>myMap</jv>);
319       * </p>
320       *
321       * @return This object.
322       */
323      @FluentSetter
324      public Builder addBeanTypes() {
325         return addBeanTypes(true);
326      }
327
328      /**
329       * Same as {@link #addBeanTypes()} but allows you to explicitly specify the value.
330       *
331       * @param value The value for this setting.
332       * @return This object.
333       */
334      @FluentSetter
335      public Builder addBeanTypes(boolean value) {
336         addBeanTypes = value;
337         return this;
338      }
339
340      /**
341       * Add type attribute to root nodes.
342       *
343       * <p>
344       * When enabled, <js>"_type"</js> properties will be added to top-level beans.
345       *
346       * <p>
347       * When disabled, it is assumed that the parser knows the exact Java POJO type being parsed, and therefore top-level
348       * type information that might normally be included to determine the data type will not be serialized.
349       *
350       * <p>
351       * For example, when serializing a top-level POJO with a {@link Bean#typeName() @Bean(typeName)} value, a
352       * <js>'_type'</js> attribute will only be added when this setting is enabled.
353       *
354       * <p>
355       * Note the differences between the following settings:
356       * <ul class='javatree'>
357       *    <li class='jf'>{@link #addRootType()} - Affects whether <js>'_type'</js> is added to root node.
358       *    <li class='jf'>{@link #addBeanTypes()} - Affects whether <js>'_type'</js> is added to any nodes.
359       * </ul>
360       *
361       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
362       * <p class='bjava'>
363       *    <jc>// Create a serializer that adds _type to root node.</jc>
364       *    WriterSerializer <jv>serializer</jv>= JsonSerializer
365       *       .<jsm>create</jsm>()
366       *       .addRootType()
367       *       .build();
368       *
369       *    <jc>// Our bean to serialize.</jc>
370       *    <ja>@Bean</ja>(typeName=<js>"mybean"</js>)
371       *    <jk>public class</jk> MyBean {
372       *       <jk>public</jk> String <jf>foo</jf> = <js>"bar"</js>;
373       *    }
374       *
375       *    <jc>// Will contain:  {"_type":"mybean","foo":"bar"}</jc>
376       *    String <jv>json</jv> = <jv>serializer</jv>.serialize(<jk>new</jk> MyBean());
377       * </p>
378       *
379       * @return This object.
380       */
381      @FluentSetter
382      public Builder addRootType() {
383         return addRootType(true);
384      }
385
386      /**
387       * Same as {@link #addRootType()} but allows you to explicitly specify the value.
388       *
389       * @param value The value for this setting.
390       * @return This object.
391       */
392      @FluentSetter
393      public Builder addRootType(boolean value) {
394         addRootType = value;
395         return this;
396      }
397
398      /**
399       * Don't trim null bean property values.
400       *
401       * <p>
402       * When enabled, null bean values will be serialized to the output.
403       *
404       * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
405       *    <li class='note'>Not enabling this setting will cause <c>Map</c>s with <jk>null</jk> values to be lost during parsing.
406       * </ul>
407       *
408       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
409       * <p class='bjava'>
410       *    <jc>// Create a serializer that serializes null properties.</jc>
411       *    WriterSerializer <jv>serializer</jv> = JsonSerializer
412       *       .<jsm>create</jsm>()
413       *       .keepNullProperties()
414       *       .build();
415       *
416       *    <jc>// Our bean to serialize.</jc>
417       *    <jk>public class</jk> MyBean {
418       *       <jk>public</jk> String <jf>foo</jf> = <jk>null</jk>;
419       *    }
420       *
421       *    <jc>// Will contain "{foo:null}".</jc>
422       *    String <jv>json</jv> = <jv>serializer</jv>.serialize(<jk>new</jk> MyBean());
423       * </p>
424       *
425       * @return This object.
426       */
427      @FluentSetter
428      public Builder keepNullProperties() {
429         return keepNullProperties(true);
430      }
431
432      /**
433       * Same as {@link #keepNullProperties()} but allows you to explicitly specify the value.
434       *
435       * @param value The value for this setting.
436       * @return This object.
437       */
438      @FluentSetter
439      public Builder keepNullProperties(boolean value) {
440         keepNullProperties = value;
441         return this;
442      }
443
444      /**
445       * Serializer listener.
446       *
447       * <p>
448       * Class used to listen for errors and warnings that occur during serialization.
449       *
450       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
451       * <p class='bjava'>
452       *    <jc>// Define our serializer listener.</jc>
453       *    <jc>// Simply captures all errors.</jc>
454       *    <jk>public class</jk> MySerializerListener <jk>extends</jk> SerializerListener {
455       *
456       *       <jc>// A simple property to store our events.</jc>
457       *       <jk>public</jk> List&lt;String&gt; <jf>events</jf> = <jk>new</jk> LinkedList&lt;&gt;();
458       *
459       *       <ja>@Override</ja>
460       *       <jk>public</jk> &lt;T&gt; <jk>void</jk> onError(SerializerSession <jv>session</jv>, Throwable <jv>throwable</jv>, String <jv>msg</jv>) {
461       *          <jf>events</jf>.add(<jv>session</jv>.getLastLocation() + <js>","</js> + <jv>msg</jv> + <js>","</js> + <jv>throwable</jv>);
462       *       }
463       *    }
464       *
465       *    <jc>// Create a serializer using our listener.</jc>
466       *    WriterSerializer <jv>serializer</jv> = JsonSerializer
467       *       .<jsm>create</jsm>()
468       *       .listener(MySerializerListener.<jk>class</jk>)
469       *       .build();
470       *
471       *    <jc>// Create a session object.</jc>
472       *    <jc>// Needed because listeners are created per-session.</jc>
473       *    <jk>try</jk> (WriterSerializerSession <jv>session</jv> = <jv>serializer</jv>.createSession()) {
474       *
475       *       <jc>// Serialize a bean.</jc>
476       *       String <jv>json</jv> = <jv>session</jv>.serialize(<jk>new</jk> MyBean());
477       *
478       *       <jc>// Get the listener.</jc>
479       *       MySerializerListener <jv>listener</jv> = <jv>session</jv>.getListener(MySerializerListener.<jk>class</jk>);
480       *
481       *       <jc>// Dump the results to the console.</jc>
482       *       Json5.<jsf>DEFAULT</jsf>.println(<jv>listener</jv>.<jf>events</jf>);
483       *    }
484       * </p>
485       *
486       * @param value
487       *    The new value for this property.
488       * @return This object.
489       */
490      @FluentSetter
491      public Builder listener(Class<? extends SerializerListener> value) {
492         listener = value;
493         return this;
494      }
495
496      /**
497       * Sort arrays and collections alphabetically.
498       *
499       * <p>
500       * When enabled, copies and sorts the contents of arrays and collections before serializing them.
501       *
502       * <p>
503       * Note that this introduces a performance penalty since it requires copying the existing collection.
504       *
505       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
506       * <p class='bjava'>
507       *    <jc>// Create a serializer that sorts arrays and collections before serialization.</jc>
508       *    WriterSerializer <jv>serializer</jv> = JsonSerializer
509       *       .<jsm>create</jsm>()
510       *       .sortCollections()
511       *       .build();
512       *
513       *    <jc>// An unsorted array</jc>
514       *    String[] <jv>myArray</jv> = {<js>"foo"</js>,<js>"bar"</js>,<js>"baz"</js>};
515       *
516       *    <jc>// Produces ["bar","baz","foo"]</jc>
517       *    String <jv>json</jv> = <jv>serializer</jv>.serialize(<jv>myArray</jv>);
518       * </p>
519       *
520       * @return This object.
521       */
522      @FluentSetter
523      public Builder sortCollections() {
524         return sortCollections(true);
525      }
526
527      /**
528       * Same as {@link #sortCollections()} but allows you to explicitly specify the value.
529       *
530       * @param value The value for this setting.
531       * @return This object.
532       */
533      @FluentSetter
534      public Builder sortCollections(boolean value) {
535         sortCollections = value;
536         return this;
537      }
538
539      /**
540       * Sort maps alphabetically.
541       *
542       * <p>
543       * When enabled, copies and sorts the contents of maps by their keys before serializing them.
544       *
545       * <p>
546       * Note that this introduces a performance penalty.
547       *
548       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
549       * <p class='bjava'>
550       *    <jc>// Create a serializer that sorts maps before serialization.</jc>
551       *    WriterSerializer <jv>serializer</jv> = JsonSerializer
552       *       .<jsm>create</jsm>()
553       *       .sortMaps()
554       *       .build();
555       *
556       *    <jc>// An unsorted map.</jc>
557       *    JsonMap <jv>myMap</jv> = JsonMap.<jsm>of</jsm>(<js>"foo"</js>,1,<js>"bar"</js>,2,<js>"baz"</js>,3);
558       *
559       *    <jc>// Produces {"bar":2,"baz":3,"foo":1}</jc>
560       *    String <jv>json</jv> = <jv>serializer</jv>.serialize(<jv>myMap</jv>);
561       * </p>
562       *
563       * @return This object.
564       */
565      @FluentSetter
566      public Builder sortMaps() {
567         return sortMaps(true);
568      }
569
570      /**
571       * Same as {@link #sortMaps()} but allows you to explicitly specify the value.
572       *
573       * @param value The value for this setting.
574       * @return This object.
575       */
576      @FluentSetter
577      public Builder sortMaps(boolean value) {
578         sortMaps = value;
579         return this;
580      }
581
582      /**
583       * Trim empty lists and arrays.
584       *
585       * <p>
586       * When enabled, empty lists and arrays will not be serialized.
587       *
588       * <p>
589       * Note that enabling this setting has the following effects on parsing:
590       * <ul class='spaced-list'>
591       *    <li>
592       *       Map entries with empty list values will be lost.
593       *    <li>
594       *       Bean properties with empty list values will not be set.
595       * </ul>
596       *
597       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
598       * <p class='bjava'>
599       *    <jc>// Create a serializer that skips empty arrays and collections.</jc>
600       *    WriterSerializer <jv>serializer</jv> = JsonSerializer
601       *       .<jsm>create</jsm>()
602       *       .trimEmptyCollections()
603       *       .build();
604       *
605       *    <jc>// A bean with a field with an empty array.</jc>
606       *    <jk>public class</jk> MyBean {
607       *       <jk>public</jk> String[] <jf>foo</jf> = {};
608       *    }
609       *
610       *    <jc>// Produces {}</jc>
611       *    String <jv>json</jv> = <jv>serializer</jv>.serialize(<jk>new</jk> MyBean());
612       * </p>
613       *
614       * @return This object.
615       */
616      @FluentSetter
617      public Builder trimEmptyCollections() {
618         return trimEmptyCollections(true);
619      }
620
621      /**
622       * Same as {@link #trimEmptyCollections()} but allows you to explicitly specify the value.
623       *
624       * @param value The value for this setting.
625       * @return This object.
626       */
627      @FluentSetter
628      public Builder trimEmptyCollections(boolean value) {
629         trimEmptyCollections = value;
630         return this;
631      }
632
633      /**
634       * Trim empty maps.
635       *
636       * <p>
637       * When enabled, empty map values will not be serialized to the output.
638       *
639       * <p>
640       * Note that enabling this setting has the following effects on parsing:
641       * <ul class='spaced-list'>
642       *    <li>
643       *       Bean properties with empty map values will not be set.
644       * </ul>
645       *
646       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
647       * <p class='bjava'>
648       *    <jc>// Create a serializer that skips empty maps.</jc>
649       *    WriterSerializer <jv>serializer</jv> = JsonSerializer
650       *       .<jsm>create</jsm>()
651       *       .trimEmptyMaps()
652       *       .build();
653       *
654       *    <jc>// A bean with a field with an empty map.</jc>
655       *    <jk>public class</jk> MyBean {
656       *       <jk>public</jk> JsonMap <jf>foo</jf> = JsonMap.<jsm>of</jsm>();
657       *    }
658       *
659       *    <jc>// Produces {}</jc>
660       *    String <jv>json</jv> = <jv>serializer</jv>.serialize(<jk>new</jk> MyBean());
661       * </p>
662       *
663       * @return This object.
664       */
665      @FluentSetter
666      public Builder trimEmptyMaps() {
667         return trimEmptyMaps(true);
668      }
669
670      /**
671       * Same as {@link #trimEmptyMaps()} but allows you to explicitly specify the value.
672       *
673       * @param value The value for this setting.
674       * @return This object.
675       */
676      @FluentSetter
677      public Builder trimEmptyMaps(boolean value) {
678         trimEmptyMaps = value;
679         return this;
680      }
681
682      /**
683       * Trim strings.
684       *
685       * <p>
686       * When enabled, string values will be trimmed of whitespace using {@link String#trim()} before being serialized.
687       *
688       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
689       * <p class='bjava'>
690       *    <jc>// Create a serializer that trims strings before serialization.</jc>
691       *    WriterSerializer <jv>serializer</jv> = JsonSerializer
692       *       .<jsm>create</jsm>()
693       *       .trimStrings()
694       *       .build();
695       *
696       * <jc>// A map with space-padded keys/values</jc>
697       *    JsonMap <jv>myMap</jv> = JsonMap.<jsm>of</jsm>(<js>" foo "</js>, <js>" bar "</js>);
698       *
699       *    <jc>// Produces "{foo:'bar'}"</jc>
700       *    String <jv>json</jv> = <jv>serializer</jv>.toString(<jv>myMap</jv>);
701       * </p>
702       *
703       * @return This object.
704       */
705      @FluentSetter
706      public Builder trimStrings() {
707         return trimStrings(true);
708      }
709
710      /**
711       * Same as {@link #trimStrings()} but allows you to explicitly specify the value.
712       *
713       * @param value The value for this setting.
714       * @return This object.
715       */
716      @FluentSetter
717      public Builder trimStrings(boolean value) {
718         trimStrings = value;
719         return this;
720      }
721
722      /**
723       * URI context bean.
724       *
725       * <p>
726       * Bean used for resolution of URIs to absolute or root-relative form.
727       *
728       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
729       * <p class='bjava'>
730       *    <jc>// Our URI contextual information.</jc>
731       *    String <jv>authority</jv> = <js>"http://localhost:10000"</js>;
732       *    String <jv>contextRoot</jv> = <js>"/myContext"</js>;
733       *    String <jv>servletPath</jv> = <js>"/myServlet"</js>;
734       *    String <jv>pathInfo</jv> = <js>"/foo"</js>;
735       *
736       *    <jc>// Create a UriContext object.</jc>
737       *    UriContext <jv>uriContext</jv> = <jk>new</jk> UriContext(<jv>authority</jv>, <jv>contextRoot</jv>, <jv>servletPath</jv>, <jv>pathInfo</jv>);
738       *
739       *    <jc>// Associate it with our serializer.</jc>
740       *    WriterSerializer <jv>serializer</jv> = JsonSerializer
741       *       .<jsm>create</jsm>()
742       *       .uriContext(<jv>uriContext</jv>)
743       *       .uriRelativity(<jsf>RESOURCE</jsf>)  <jc>// Assume relative paths are relative to servlet.</jc>
744       *       .uriResolution(<jsf>ABSOLUTE</jsf>)  <jc>// Serialize URLs as absolute paths.</jc>
745       *       .build();
746       *
747       *    <jc>// A relative URL</jc>
748       *    URL <jv>myUrl</jv> = <jk>new</jk> URL(<js>"bar"</js>);
749       *
750       *    <jc>// Produces "http://localhost:10000/myContext/myServlet/foo/bar"</jc>
751       *    String <jv>json</jv> = <jv>serializer</jv>.toString(<jv>myUrl</jv>);
752       * </p>
753       *
754       * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
755       *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/MarshallingUris">URIs</a>
756       * </ul>
757       *
758       * @param value The new value for this property.
759       * @return This object.
760       */
761      @FluentSetter
762      public Builder uriContext(UriContext value) {
763         uriContext = value;
764         return this;
765      }
766
767      /**
768       * URI relativity.
769       *
770       * <p>
771       * Defines what relative URIs are relative to when serializing any of the following:
772       * <ul>
773       *    <li>{@link java.net.URI}
774       *    <li>{@link java.net.URL}
775       *    <li>Properties and classes annotated with {@link Uri @Uri}
776       * </ul>
777       *
778       * <p>
779       * See {@link #uriContext(UriContext)} for examples.
780       *
781       * <ul class='values javatree'>
782       *    <li class='jf'>{@link org.apache.juneau.UriRelativity#RESOURCE}
783       *       - Relative URIs should be considered relative to the servlet URI.
784       *    <li class='jf'>{@link org.apache.juneau.UriRelativity#PATH_INFO}
785       *       - Relative URIs should be considered relative to the request URI.
786       * </ul>
787       *
788       * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
789       *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/MarshallingUris">URIs</a>
790       * </ul>
791       *
792       * @param value
793       *    The new value for this property.
794       *    <br>The default is {@link UriRelativity#RESOURCE}
795       * @return This object.
796       */
797      @FluentSetter
798      public Builder uriRelativity(UriRelativity value) {
799         uriRelativity = value;
800         return this;
801      }
802
803      /**
804       * URI resolution.
805       *
806       * <p>
807       * Defines the resolution level for URIs when serializing any of the following:
808       * <ul>
809       *    <li>{@link java.net.URI}
810       *    <li>{@link java.net.URL}
811       *    <li>Properties and classes annotated with {@link Uri @Uri}
812       * </ul>
813       *
814       * <p>
815       * See {@link #uriContext(UriContext)} for examples.
816       *
817       * <ul class='values javatree'>
818       *    <li class='jf'>{@link UriResolution#ABSOLUTE}
819       *       - Resolve to an absolute URL (e.g. <js>"http://host:port/context-root/servlet-path/path-info"</js>).
820       *    <li class='jf'>{@link UriResolution#ROOT_RELATIVE}
821       *       - Resolve to a root-relative URL (e.g. <js>"/context-root/servlet-path/path-info"</js>).
822       *    <li class='jf'>{@link UriResolution#NONE}
823       *       - Don't do any URL resolution.
824       * </ul>
825       *
826       * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
827       *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/MarshallingUris">URIs</a>
828       * </ul>
829       *
830       * @param value
831       *    The new value for this property.
832       *    <br>The default is {@link UriResolution#NONE}
833       * @return This object.
834       */
835      @FluentSetter
836      public Builder uriResolution(UriResolution value) {
837         uriResolution = value;
838         return this;
839      }
840

1301
1302   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1303   // Instance
1304   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1305
1306   final String produces, accept;
1307   final boolean
1308      addBeanTypes,
1309      keepNullProperties,
1310      trimEmptyCollections,
1311      trimEmptyMaps,
1312      trimStrings,
1313      sortCollections,
1314      sortMaps,
1315      addRootType;
1316   final UriContext uriContext;
1317   final UriResolution uriResolution;
1318   final UriRelativity uriRelativity;
1319   final Class<? extends SerializerListener> listener;
1320
1321   private final MediaRanges acceptRanges;
1322   private final MediaType[] acceptMediaTypes;
1323   private final MediaType producesMediaType;
1324
1325   /**
1326    * Constructor
1327    *
1328    * @param builder The builder this object.
1329    */
1330   protected Serializer(Builder builder) {
1331      super(builder);
1332
1333      produces = builder.produces;
1334      accept = builder.accept;
1335      addBeanTypes = builder.addBeanTypes;
1336      keepNullProperties = builder.keepNullProperties;
1337      trimEmptyCollections = builder.trimEmptyCollections;
1338      trimEmptyMaps = builder.trimEmptyMaps;
1339      trimStrings = builder.trimStrings;
1340      sortCollections = builder.sortCollections;
1341      sortMaps = builder.sortMaps;
1342      addRootType = builder.addRootType;
1343      uriContext = builder.uriContext;
1344      uriResolution = builder.uriResolution;
1345      uriRelativity = builder.uriRelativity;
1346      listener = builder.listener;
1347
1348      this.producesMediaType = MediaType.of(produces);
1349      this.acceptRanges = accept != null ? MediaRanges.of(accept) : MediaRanges.of(produces);
1350      this.acceptMediaTypes = builder.accept != null ? MediaType.ofAll(splita(builder.accept)) : new MediaType[] {this.producesMediaType};
1351   }
1352
1353   @Override /* Context */
1354   public Builder copy() {
1355      return new Builder(this);
1356   }
1357
1358   @Override /* Context */
1359   public SerializerSession.Builder createSession() {
1360      return SerializerSession.create(this);
1361   }
1362
1363   @Override /* Context */
1364   public SerializerSession getSession() {
1365      return createSession().build();
1366   }
1367
1368   /**
1369    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if this serializer subclasses from {@link WriterSerializer}.
1370    *
1371    * @return <jk>true</jk> if this serializer subclasses from {@link WriterSerializer}.
1372    */
1373   public boolean isWriterSerializer() {
1374      return false;
1375   }
1376
1377   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1378   // Convenience methods
1379   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1380
1381   /**
1382    * Serializes a POJO to the specified output stream or writer.
1383    *
1384    * <p>
1385    * Equivalent to calling <c>serializer.createSession().serialize(o, output);</c>
1386    *
1387    * @param o The object to serialize.
1388    * @param output
1389    *    The output object.
1390    *    <br>Character-based serializers can handle the following output class types:
1391    *    <ul>
1392    *       <li>{@link Writer}
1393    *       <li>{@link OutputStream} - Output will be written as UTF-8 encoded stream.
1394    *       <li>{@link File} - Output will be written as system-default encoded stream.
1395    *       <li>{@link StringBuilder} - Output will be written to the specified string builder.
1396    *    </ul>
1397    *    <br>Stream-based serializers can handle the following output class types:
1398    *    <ul>
1399    *       <li>{@link OutputStream}
1400    *       <li>{@link File}
1401    *    </ul>
1402    * @throws SerializeException If a problem occurred trying to convert the output.
1403    * @throws IOException Thrown by the underlying stream.
1404    */
1405   public final void serialize(Object o, Object output) throws SerializeException, IOException {
1406      getSession().serialize(o, output);
1407   }
1408
1409   /**
1410    * Shortcut method for serializing objects directly to either a <c>String</c> or <code><jk>byte</jk>[]</code>
1411    * depending on the serializer type.
1412    *
1413    * @param o The object to serialize.
1414    * @return
1415    *    The serialized object.
1416    *    <br>Character-based serializers will return a <c>String</c>
1417    *    <br>Stream-based serializers will return a <code><jk>byte</jk>[]</code>
1418    * @throws SerializeException If a problem occurred trying to convert the output.
1419    */
1420   public Object serialize(Object o) throws SerializeException {
1421      return getSession().serialize(o);
1422   }
1423
1424   /**
1425    * Convenience method for serializing an object to a String.
1426    *
1427    * <p>
1428    * For writer-based serializers, this is identical to calling {@link #serialize(Object)}.
1429    * <br>For stream-based serializers, this converts the returned byte array to a string based on
1430    * the {@link OutputStreamSerializer.Builder#binaryFormat(BinaryFormat)} setting.
1431    *
1432    * @param o The object to serialize.
1433    * @return The output serialized to a string.
1434    * @throws SerializeException If a problem occurred trying to convert the output.
1435    */
1436   public final String serializeToString(Object o) throws SerializeException {
1437      return getSession().serializeToString(o);
1438   }
1439
1440   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1441   // Other methods
1442   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1443
1444   /**
1445    * Serializes a POJO to the specified pipe.
1446    *
1447    * @param session The current session.
1448    * @param pipe Where to send the output from the serializer.
1449    * @param o The object to serialize.
1450    * @throws IOException Thrown by underlying stream.
1451    * @throws SerializeException Problem occurred trying to serialize object.
1452    */
1453   protected void doSerialize(SerializerSession session, SerializerPipe pipe, Object o) throws IOException, SerializeException {
1454      throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
1455   }
1456
1457   /**
1458    * Optional method that specifies HTTP request headers for this serializer.
1459    *
1460    * <p>
1461    * For example, {@link SoapXmlSerializer} needs to set a <c>SOAPAction</c> header.
1462    *
1463    * <p>
1464    * This method is typically meaningless if the serializer is being used stand-alone (i.e. outside of a REST server
1465    * or client).
1466    *
1467    * @param session The current session.
1468    * @return
1469    *    The HTTP headers to set on HTTP requests.
1470    *    Never <jk>null</jk>.
1471    */
1472   public Map<String,String> getResponseHeaders(SerializerSession session) {
1473      return Collections.emptyMap();
1474   }
1475
1476   /**
1477    * Returns the media types handled based on the value of the <c>accept</c> parameter passed into the constructor.
1478    *
1479    * <p>
1480    * Note that the order of these ranges are from high to low q-value.
1481    *
1482    * @return The list of media types.  Never <jk>null</jk>.
1483    */
1484   public final MediaRanges getMediaTypeRanges() {
1485      return acceptRanges;
1486   }
1487
1488   /**
1489    * Returns the first entry in the <c>accept</c> parameter passed into the constructor.
1490    *
1491    * <p>
1492    * This signifies the 'primary' media type for this serializer.
1493    *
1494    * @return The media type.  Never <jk>null</jk>.
1495    */
1496   public final MediaType getPrimaryMediaType() {
1497      return acceptMediaTypes[0];
1498   }
1499
1500   /**
1501    * Performs an action on the media types handled based on the value of the <c>accept</c> parameter passed into the constructor.
1502    *
1503    * <p>
1504    * The order of the media types are the same as those in the <c>accept</c> parameter.
1505    *
1506    * @param action The action to perform on the media types.
1507    * @return This object.
1508    */
1509   public final Serializer forEachAcceptMediaType(Consumer<MediaType> action) {
1510      for (MediaType m : acceptMediaTypes)
1511         action.accept(m);
1512      return this;
1513   }
1514
1515   /**
1516    * Optional method that returns the response <c>Content-Type</c> for this serializer if it is different from
1517    * the matched media type.
1518    *
1519    * <p>
1520    * This method is specified to override the content type for this serializer.
1521    * For example, the {@link org.apache.juneau.json.Json5Serializer} class returns that it handles media type
1522    * <js>"text/json5"</js>, but returns <js>"text/json"</js> as the actual content type.
1523    * This allows clients to request specific 'flavors' of content using specialized <c>Accept</c> header values.
1524    *
1525    * <p>
1526    * This method is typically meaningless if the serializer is being used stand-alone (i.e. outside of a REST server
1527    * or client).
1528    *
1529    * @return The response content type.  If <jk>null</jk>, then the matched media type is used.
1530    */
1531   public final MediaType getResponseContentType() {
1532      return producesMediaType;
1533   }
1534
1535   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1536   // Properties
1537   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1538
1539   /**
1540    * Add <js>"_type"</js> properties when needed.
1541    *
1542    * @see Serializer.Builder#addBeanTypes()
1543    * @return
1544    *    <jk>true</jk> if <js>"_type"</js> properties added to beans if their type cannot be inferred
1545    *    through reflection.
1546    */
1547   protected boolean isAddBeanTypes() {
1548      return addBeanTypes;
1549   }
1550
1551   /**
1552    * Add type attribute to root nodes.
1553    *
1554    * @see Serializer.Builder#addRootType()
1555    * @return
1556    *    <jk>true</jk> if type property should be added to root node.
1557    */
1558   protected final boolean isAddRootType() {
1559      return addRootType;
1560   }
1561
1562   /**
1563    * Serializer listener.
1564    *
1565    * @see Serializer.Builder#listener(Class)
1566    * @return
1567    *    Class used to listen for errors and warnings that occur during serialization.
1568    */
1569   protected final Class<? extends SerializerListener> getListener() {
1570      return listener;
1571   }
1572
1573   /**
1574    * Sort arrays and collections alphabetically.
1575    *
1576    * @see Serializer.Builder#sortCollections()
1577    * @return
1578    *    <jk>true</jk> if arrays and collections are copied and sorted before serialization.
1579    */
1580   protected final boolean isSortCollections() {
1581      return sortCollections;
1582   }
1583
1584   /**
1585    * Sort maps alphabetically.
1586    *
1587    * @see Serializer.Builder#sortMaps()
1588    * @return
1589    *    <jk>true</jk> if maps are copied and sorted before serialization.
1590    */
1591   protected final boolean isSortMaps() {
1592      return sortMaps;
1593   }
1594
1595   /**
1596    * Trim empty lists and arrays.
1597    *
1598    * @see Serializer.Builder#trimEmptyCollections()
1599    * @return
1600    *    <jk>true</jk> if empty lists and arrays are not serialized to the output.
1601    */
1602   protected final boolean isTrimEmptyCollections() {
1603      return trimEmptyCollections;
1604   }
1605
1606   /**
1607    * Trim empty maps.
1608    *
1609    * @see Serializer.Builder#trimEmptyMaps()
1610    * @return
1611    *    <jk>true</jk> if empty map values are not serialized to the output.
1612    */
1613   protected final boolean isTrimEmptyMaps() {
1614      return trimEmptyMaps;
1615   }
1616
1617   /**
1618    * Don't trim null bean property values.
1619    *
1620    * @see Serializer.Builder#keepNullProperties()
1621    * @return
1622    *    <jk>true</jk> if null bean values are serialized to the output.
1623    */
1624   protected final boolean isKeepNullProperties() {
1625      return keepNullProperties;
1626   }
1627
1628   /**
1629    * Trim strings.
1630    *
1631    * @see Serializer.Builder#trimStrings()
1632    * @return
1633    *    <jk>true</jk> if string values will be trimmed of whitespace using {@link String#trim()} before being serialized.
1634    */
1635   protected final boolean isTrimStrings() {
1636      return trimStrings;
1637   }
1638
1639   /**
1640    * URI context bean.
1641    *
1642    * @see Serializer.Builder#uriContext(UriContext)
1643    * @return
1644    *    Bean used for resolution of URIs to absolute or root-relative form.
1645    */
1646   protected final UriContext getUriContext() {
1647      return uriContext;
1648   }
1649
1650   /**
1651    * URI relativity.
1652    *
1653    * @see Serializer.Builder#uriRelativity(UriRelativity)
1654    * @return
1655    *    Defines what relative URIs are relative to when serializing any of the following:
1656    */
1657   protected final UriRelativity getUriRelativity() {
1658      return uriRelativity;
1659   }
1660
1661   /**
1662    * URI resolution.
1663    *
1664    * @see Serializer.Builder#uriResolution(UriResolution)
1665    * @return
1666    *    Defines the resolution level for URIs when serializing URIs.
1667    */
1668   protected final UriResolution getUriResolution() {
1669      return uriResolution;
1670   }
1671
1672   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1673   // Other methods
1674   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1675
1676   @Override /* Context */
1677   protected JsonMap properties() {
1678      return filteredMap()
1679         .append("addBeanTypes", addBeanTypes)
1680         .append("keepNullProperties", keepNullProperties)
1681         .append("trimEmptyCollections", trimEmptyCollections)
1682         .append("trimEmptyMaps", trimEmptyMaps)
1683         .append("trimStrings", trimStrings)
1684         .append("sortCollections", sortCollections)
1685         .append("sortMaps", sortMaps)
1686         .append("addRootType", addRootType)
1687         .append("uriContext", uriContext)
1688         .append("uriResolution", uriResolution)
1689         .append("uriRelativity", uriRelativity)
1690         .append("listener", listener);
1691   }
1692}
